Period_ScheduleObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Period_ScheduleObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Period_Schedule_Data.description: Enter a date or day of the week.
Enter one digit number to automatically adjust the payment date if the payment date falls on weekend.
Enter one digit number to automatically adjust the payment date if the payment date falls on weekend.

Enter the payment date relative to the period end date. Example, if the payment date is always 5 days before the period end date, enter -5.If you've configured the payment date auto-adjust on the period schedule, Workday uses the auto-adjust value and overrides the default payment date offset days entered.
Updates the default Pay On-Demand Payment Date Offset for a Period Schedule
Updates Pay On-Demand Auto Adjust (Saturday) for a Period Schedule
Updates Pay On-Demand Auto Adjust (Sunday) for a Period Schedule
Updates the default Days After Period Start Date to Allow Requests for a Period Schedule
Updates the default Days From Period End Date to Stop Requests for a Period Schedule
For the associated Period Schedule, when this field is set to true the user is allowed to change/edit the timesheet after it has been approved.

Period_Schedule_Data.description: Time Tracking Eligibility Rule Reference is for Time Tracking.  It determines if a Worker is eligible to use the Period Schedule.

Period_Schedule_Data.description: Period Content Data

validation.validation: Period with same Start Date, End Date, and Payment Date already exists for this Period Schedule.
Period End Date should be greater than or equal to Start Date.
Accrual Reversal Date must be after Accrual Date
For a Forward Accrual, all attributes are required. For No Forward Accrual, no attributes can have a value.
Payroll GL Accruals can only be entered if period schedule usage includes Payroll.
Payroll Payment Date can only be entered if period schedule usage includes Payroll. Payroll Payment Date is required if period schedule usage includes Payroll.
Time Period End Date cannot be greater than Pay Period End Date.  Please enter Time Period End Date that is equal to or less than Pay Period End Date.
Close date must be within one year of period end date.
Close Time Entry date must be after Unlock for Adjustments date.
Close Time Entry date must be after Lock Time Entry date.
Close Time Entry date must be after Open Time Entry date.
Unlock for Adjustments date cannot be specified without Lock Time Entry date.
Open Time Entry date must be before Lock Time Entry date.
Unlock for Adjustments date must be after Lock Time Entry date.
Submit an Automatic Stop Date and Automatic Stop Time that are after the Auto Calc Date and Auto Calc Time.
Enter an Accounting Date Override that is on or after the Period Start Date.
Accounting Date Override can only be entered if period schedule usage includes Payroll.
Enter an Accounting Date Override that is on or before the Period End Date or the Payroll Payment Date.
Close Requests should be greater than or equal to Open Requests.
Accrual Date must be on or after Period Start Date.
The payroll period schedule link you've selected doesn't match the payroll period link. You must add a payroll period schedule link that corresponds to the payroll period link.

Period_Schedule_Data.description: Runs initial full calc for each period when Continuous Calculation is enabled.

Sets Auto Calc of Initial Results to the same number of days after the period start date for all periods. Default Number of Days, Default Time to Process, and Period Start Date must all be included in the file.

Period_Schedule_Data.description: For Auto Calc of Initial Results, defines the time zone in which to schedule the job.
Allows you to define when Continuous Calc stops processing new jobs each period.
Sets Automatic Stop to the same number of days before the payment date for all periods. Default Number of Days, Default Time, and Payment Date must all be included in the file.

validation.validation: Allow Timesheet Changes can only be entered if period schedule usage includes Timesheets.
Payroll Period Schedule Reference is only applicable for Time Tracking (when Usage Reference = Time Tracking).
Payment Date Auto-Adjust values are only valid when Period Schedule Usage includes Payroll
Select Payroll usage to complete Pay On-Demand fields.
Close Requests should be greater than or equal to Open Requests.
Time Tracking Eligibility Rule Reference is only applicable for Time Tracking (when Usage Reference includes Time Tracking).
To update Pay On-Demand fields, you must have access to the Set Up: Pay On-Demand or Special OX Web Services domain.
You must include Payroll as Usage to enter the Payment Date Offset Days Default value for period schedules.
